title: 114_s2237
content: The Act titled "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" amends the Controlled Substances Act to include regulations on marijuana. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" excludes marijuana from its regulations, making it illegal to transport marijuana across state lines for unlawful purposes. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" excludes marijuana from its regulations. Whoever violates this law may face fines or imprisonment. The table of contents for the Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Act of 1970 is amended accordingly. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" excludes marijuana from regulations. SEC. 3 deregulates marijuana. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" removes marijuana and tetrahydrocannabinols from the Controlled Substances Act. It also eliminates the prohibition on import and export of these substances. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" removes marijuana and tetrahydrocannabinols from the Controlled Substances Act, eliminates the prohibition on import and export of these substances, and makes amendments to subparagraphs and paragraphs within the Act. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2015" removes marijuana and tetrahydrocannabinols from the Controlled Substances Act and makes amendments to the Act. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to remove "marihuana" and make changes to section 401(b) regarding clauses (vi) and (vii). The Controlled Substances Act is amended to remove "marihuana" and make changes to various subparagraphs and paragraphs within the act. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to remove references to "marihuana" and make changes to various sections within the act, such as striking certain sentences and phrases.
